alert.note: Alert for Broward; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 7:16PM EDT until June 04 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains moving eastward from the interior areas of Palm Beach County into the Southeast metro areas of Palm Beach County capable of producing rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches on top of the already 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen from last night heavy rains. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Delray Beach, Highland Beach, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Whisper Walk, Boca Del Mar, Kings Point, Boca Pointe, Mission Bay, Loxahatchee NWR, Gulf Stream, Boca West, Morikami Park, Fau South Campus, Boca Raton Equestrian, Sandalfoot Cove and Villages Of Oriole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
